newsitem.title: UK: LSE's Crest system to provide rebates - report.
newsitem.headline: LSE's Crest system to provide rebates - report.

text.p: Crest, the London Stock Exchange's new computerised share settlement system, is to repay half of its peak-time user costs during the past two months because of problems and delays, the Telegraph newspaper reported on Thursday.
It said Crest's board decided to reduce the fee for sending information to 30 pence in October and November. The standard fee is 60 pence.
The report cited a letter sent to the 243 stockbrokers, registrars and other financial businesses, which act as the link between Crest and investors.

The rebate, which was granted because of "the disturbance to our and your timetable and the somewhat erratic processing of messages at times during October," will cost Crest 110,000 pounds sterling, the Telegraph said.

Crest began operating in July, with the move of 3,000 quoted securities to the new system from the old one phased over 10 months. The Telegraph said pressure on the system in October forced postponemnt of the transfer of 17 companies, including British Telecommunications Plc and Barclays Plc.
